title: Manna and Quail from Heaven
summary: Exodus 16 describes how the Israelites complain about hunger in the wilderness. God responds by sending manna in the morning and quail in the evening. He instructs them to gather only enough for each day, except before the Sabbath.

faq.question: What is manna?
faq.answer: A miraculous bread-like food God provided daily in the wilderness.

faq.question: What lesson did God teach through manna?
faq.answer: To trust Him daily for provision and to observe the Sabbath rest.
